SENT.plain: Blood, pH and bicarbonate were examined in 40 normal subjects and in 53 patients with anemia
Included were 28 patients with thalassemia, 18 with aplastic anemia and seven with iron deficiency anemia
Mean increases in pH of 0-0.04 and decreases in HCO3 of 2.3-3.5 mEq/L were observed
Changes were not significantly affected by the degree of erythropoiesis or by the severity of the anemia and were essentially the same in the three groups of patients studied
Typical changes of a mild, uncompensated alkalosis were also produced on four occasions in one transfused thalassemic patient
